meanings.definition: porkiest: superlative form of porky, meaning resembling or characteristic of pork
meanings.sent1: The bacon at breakfast was the porkiest I had ever tasted.
meanings.sent2: The porkiest dish on the menu was the pulled pork sandwich.
meanings.sent3: The pig mascot at the fair looked like the porkiest pig in town.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks were as porky as a pig's, rosy and plump.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the barbecue was so porky, it made my mouth water.

meanings.definition: porkiest: comparative form of porky, meaning having a lot of fat or flesh
meanings.sent1: The porkiest pig in the pen was the largest and heaviest.
meanings.sent2: After the feast, he felt like the porkiest person in the room.
meanings.sent3: The porkiest cake at the party was so rich, it made everyone's eyes widen.
meanings.sent4: The porkiest clouds in the sky looked like fluffy pillows.
meanings.sent5: Her cat was the porkiest feline I had ever seen, with a round belly.

meanings.definition: porkiest: plural form of porky, meaning a pig or piglet
meanings.sent1: The farm had a group of the porkiest pigs happily rolling in the mud.
meanings.sent2: The porkiest in the litter was the runt, but the most playful.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled at the sight of the porkiest piglet chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: The field was filled with the porkiest, snorting happily in the sun.
meanings.sent5: The porkiest at the petting zoo was a favorite among visitors for its friendly nature.
